intro: Parasenecio jiulongensis, commonly known as the Jiulongshan composite, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
